lead_paragraph: CHILDS--Kirsten Anne, died of cancer at age 72 on January 13, 2016. Survived by spouse, Alexander Grinnell. She was born in Inverness, Scotland, and attended Edinburgh University. She began her career in London and was selected to collaborate with Skidmore Owings & Merrill in NYC. In 1971, Her marriage to Russell Childs kick started Armstrong Childs Associates. Her career as an interior designer flourished - culminating with Croxton Collaborative (1985-2015). She all but wrote the book on green design: Served on the US Green Building Council's LEED Steering Committee and chaired the Environmental Quality Technical Advisory Group for all LEED rating systems through 2004. Additionally, she was a founding member of LEED for Commercial Interiors, and received the 2010 ASID Designer of Distinction Award. Kirsten was a wonderful story teller, vivacious reader, bird lover, and operavore. She was a member of New York's Century Association and Waltz Society. She enjoyed travel with her dear friends and son, was a gleaming grandmother, and shall be remembered by her treasured family: Alex, Aaron, Natasha, Alexandra, Theodore, Delailah, Sebastian, Skye, and a plentitude of friends/colleagues Contact KACMem orial@gmail.com for memorial service information. Send condolences to her son, Aaron Childs, 6 Old Mill Lane, Rose Valley PA 19063. Consider donations to the SPCA and the Audubon Society. 1/3
